entry.title: Second Look at Weak Blocks
entry.summary:
The proposal under discussion raises concerns and questions around the implications of adjusting node resource requirements in exchange for the potential benefit of reducing block relay latency. Specifically, it highlights how the proposed changes might enable bypassing the `-maxmempool` setting, which could lead to increased demands on the resources required to run a node. This adjustment suggests a trade-off between operational efficiency and system performance, particularly in the context of block transmission speeds.
Furthermore, the discussion introduces a thought-provoking inquiry regarding the future of mempool management within the network. It contemplates the possibility of transitioning away from the current gossip-based mempool system towards a `PoW Mempool` model. This shift prompts considerations about the broader impacts such a change might have on the network's structure and functionality. The question implicitly explores the trade-offs between existing mechanisms of transaction propagation and novel approaches that leverage proof-of-work as a criterion for mempool inclusion, suggesting a paradigm shift in how transactions are prioritized and disseminated across the network.
